src:
Chaninng Tatum debutará en una comedia que narrará el viaje de un militar retirado

05 Nov 2019, 17:47


El actor Chaninng Tatum debutará como director de cine en una comedia que narrará el viaje de un militar retirado que recorre la costa del océano Pacífico junto a su perro para acudir al funeral de su mejor amigo.





Tatum codirigirá la película junto a su colaborador habitual Reid Carolin y también protagonizará la cinta que se titulará “Dog”, según una exclusiva publicada este martes por el medio especializado Deadline.

En el filme, el actor recordado por su papel de “stripper” en “Magic Mike” (2012) interpretará al exsoldado “ranger” Briggs, quien junto a su perro Lulu, un pastor belga de tipo malinois, viajarán por la costa estadounidense del Pacífico con el objetivo de llegar a tiempo al funeral de su mejor amigo y antiguo chófer.
Los propios Tatum y Carolin han escrito el guión de la película con Brett Rodriguez, y su rodaje comenzará previsiblemente entre la primavera y el verano de 2020 con Gregory Jacobs como productor ejecutivo.
EFE.-
text:
Chaninng Tatum will debut in a comedy that will narrate the journey of a retired military

05 Nov 2019, 17:47


Actor Chaninng Tatum will debut as a film director in a comedy that will narrate the trip of a retired military officer who travels along the Pacific Ocean coast with his dog to attend his best friend's funeral.





Tatum will co-direct the film with his usual collaborator Reid Carolin and will also star in the film entitled "Dog", according to an exclusive published Tuesday by the specialized medium Deadline.

In the film, the actor remembered for his role as “stripper” in “Magic Mike” (2012) will play former soldier “ranger” Briggs, who along with his dog Lulu, a Belgian shepherd of the Malinois type, will travel along the American coast of the Pacific with the objective of arriving in time to the funeral of his best friend and former driver.
Tatum and Carolin themselves have written the script of the film with Brett Rodriguez, and its filming will begin predictably between spring and summer 2020 with Gregory Jacobs as executive producer.
EFE.-
